original: Blacksmithing in Cambodia is closely tied to agricultural needs, making it one of the traditional crafts that endured through the tumultuous years of the Khmer Rouge regime. Today, a significant portion of blacksmiths in Cambodia belongs to the Cham minority, who have maintained this vital skill. Recently, there has been a resurgence in high-quality blacksmithing, with artisans producing knives and swords in both Khmer and Japanese styl
sampled: Blacksmithing in Cambodia is closely tied to agricultural needs, making it one among the traditional crafts that endured through the tumultuous years of the Khmer Empire regime. Today, a significant portion within blacksmiths in Cambodia belongs to the Cham minority, who have maintained this vital skill. Recently, there has manifested a resurgence in high-quality blacksmithing, with artisans producing knives and swords in both Khmer and Japanese styl
